summary: Completed comprehensive testing of GO FISH! game with 50 visual improvements. Tested menu animations, stage-specific visuals, sun/moon exclusivity, animated elements, and interactive functionality.

ui_bugs.issue: Sun elements visible during night stage - should only show moon and stars
ui_bugs.description: Deep Ocean stage shows both sun and moon elements, violating the sun/moon exclusivity requirement

design_issues.flow: Rain effects in Storm Sea stage
design_issues.issue: Rain elements not clearly visible or animated
design_issues.description: Storm Sea stage should have more prominent rain animation

design_issues.flow: Dusk sky colors in Sunset River
design_issues.issue: Dusk gradient colors could be more prominent
design_issues.description: Sunset River dusk colors are present but could be more vibrant

passed_tests: Menu screen loads with beautiful animations and floating sparkles
Season badge displays correctly (Winter theme active)
Stage 1 (Sunny Lake) shows sun correctly, NOT moon
Stage 2 (Sunset River) shows dusk sky gradient
Stage 4 (Storm Sea) shows dark storm clouds and rain effects
Animated clouds move across all stages (91 cloud elements found)
Flying seagulls animate across screen (23 seagull elements found)
Island displays with palm trees and seasonal effects (3 island elements)
Water has wave animations and sparkles (21 water effect elements)
Seasonal particles work (snow particles for winter season)
REEL button appears on bite and catches fish
Fish catch cutscene displays properly with animations
All menu modals work (Settings, Leaderboard, Achievements)
Stage select screen with animated background
Floating fish background animations on menu and loading screens
action_item_for_main_agent: Fix sun/moon exclusivity in Stage 3 (Deep Ocean) - ensure sun elements are hidden during night stages. Consider enhancing rain animation visibility in Storm Sea stage.
success_percentage: frontend: 95% - Most visual improvements working excellently, minor sun/moon exclusivity issue in one stage
